issue.title: Always override frontend widget state when set

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit — A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
For #3873

I'm somewhat confident that this change is correct, but I haven't thought through reasons it might not be enough to be sure (a smaller task than it used to be, since my changes were for reducing this complexity, but still a task).

PR isn't complete yet, because this should at minimum have an e2e regression test added.

body:
Here's a look at my application. It works completely differently since I upgraded.

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1A4u5yt0zzOZE65GlpWpsnH7f3iMeIMca/view?usp=sharing

I have multiple menus in the sidebar to set `session_states`. Previously, a) these sidebar widgets reflected `session_state` values set earlier in the code and b) they now default to "new widgets" (or something, per [announcement](https://discuss.streamlit.io/t/version-0-89-0/17397)). This changes the `session_state` when switching back and forth between menus.

Note: I hadn't upgraded to v0.89 previously, and I think issue #3754 is related.

@ryanlampkin I can't watch the video (doesn't play in my browser), so I can't tell what the problem is, and so don't know if it is related to this issue. Could you open a separate issue for it, with a small code sample that demonstrates the problem so I can either track down the cause or explain how to work with the new behavior?

@AnOctopus Uploaded a demo to youtube: https://youtu.be/ZTVokJguQvM

I know you asked me to open a new issue, but I hope this is ok instead.

issue.title: Session states not persisting after running back-end code via button press

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit — A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
### Summary

@AnOctopus Please see a video here: https://youtu.be/Jgp2hh26nwM. This is a follow-up to my post in #3873.

### Steps to reproduce

I don't really have a code snippet to reproduce, but I think the [public version of the app](https://share.streamlit.io/ryanlampkin/smg-invest-with-code/main) will reproduce the error with the following steps.

1. Select sidebar menu option "Finalize and Run"
2. Check "Agree to Terms and Conditions" (sidebar)
3. Press "Run Simulator" button
4. -- (allow process to complete. about 1 min)
5. -- (should complete as expected)
6. Repeat steps 2 & 3

After Step 6 is when a KeyError is thrown stating a particular `session_state` is not set. (A `session_state` that was required for the first successful run.)

**Expected behavior:**

I would expect Steps 4 & 5 to proceed on second run.

**Actual behavior:**

See youtube video above.

### Is this a regression?

That is, did this use to work the way you expected in the past?
Yes. I previously ran 0.87, and I think this might be related to 0.89 update

### Debug info

- Streamlit version: 1.0.0
- Python version: 3.8.0
- Using Conda? PipEnv? PyEnv? Pex? No
- OS version: Windows 10 (whatever the latest is)
- Browser version: Brave (updated)

issue.title: Setting widget values using session_state does not work after initialization

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit — A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
### Summary

If a widget's value is set by modifying the session state the widget does not update.

The [docs](https://docs.streamlit.io/library/advanced-features/session-state) state

> We can set and get the value of the temperature widget by using the Session State API

### Steps to reproduce

If you take the example stated in the docs that works fine and sets the value, but only for the first run

```
import streamlit as st

if "celsius" not in st.session_state:
    # set the initial default value of the slider widget
    st.session_state.celsius = 50.0

st.slider(
    "Temperature in Celsius",
    min_value=-100.0,
    max_value=100.0,
    key="celsius"
)

# This will get the value of the slider widget
st.write(st.session_state.celsius)
```
If you modify the session state before the widget is "initialized" the GUI does not update,
but the actual value returned from the widget is the one set.

e.g. with the following example:

```
import streamlit as st
import datetime

def cbk_text_input():
    st.write('callback text')
    st.write(datetime.datetime.now())

def cbk_slider():
    st.write('callback slider')
    st.write(datetime.datetime.now())

if 'id_input' not in st.session_state:
    st.session_state['id_input'] = ''

if 'my_slider' not in st.session_state:
    st.session_state['my_slider'] = 5

# these values do not reflect in the GUI,
# but they do in the actual value returned from the widget
st.session_state['id_input'] = 'sdf'
st.session_state['my_slider'] = 50

answer = st.text_input(f'', value='', 
                            key='id_input',
                            on_change=cbk_text_input)

x = st.slider('some slider', key='my_slider',
                         min_value=0,
                         max_value=100,
                         value=4,
                         step=5,
                         on_change=cbk_slider)

answer
st.session_state['id_input']
x
st.session_state['my_slider']
```
But I would expect the widget to also reflect a "manual" change to the session state.
I would have expected the slider to move and the text box to change its content.

### Is this a regression?

no clue

### Debug info

- Streamlit version: 1.0.0
- Python version: 3.9
- OS version: Linux Mint
- Browser version: Firefox 92.0.1
